snippet: Commissioner Roger Goodell rejected a defense that Gregg Williams, who oversaw the system offering money to injure opponents, was a rogue coach.
abstract: NFL upholds the season-long suspension of New Orleans Saints coach Sean Payton and the shorter suspensions of two other team executives, as the league continues to grapple with the bounty scandal that has overshadowed much of the off-season; Commissioner Roger Goodell rejects a defense that Gregg Williams, who oversaw the system offering money to injure opponents, was a rogue coach.
lead_paragraph: Commissioner Roger Goodell rejected a defense that Gregg Williams, who oversaw the system offering money to injure opponents, was a rogue coach.

headline.seo: N.F.L. Upholds Suspensions in Saints Bounty Scandal
headline.main: N.F.L. Upholds Suspensions in Saints Scandal
headline.print_headline: N.F.L. Upholds Suspensions In the Saints’ Bounty Scandal
